attributes.action: Stop legal action following "leave" result from EU Referendum
attributes.additional_details:
Can the government legally disregard the vote? Yes:
http://blogs.ft.com/david-allen-green/2016/06/14/can-the-united-kingdom-government-legally-disregard-a-vote-for-brexit/

Lies told by Brexit, by Farage:
https://tabloidcorrections.wordpress.com/2016/02/20/six-lies-told-by-nigel-farage-in-express-article/

Reasons for staying in the EU:
http://www.proeuropa.org.uk/twelevereasons
attributes.background: The EU referendum results are advisory but not binding. This means the government is not obliged to actually leave the EU. Sign this petition to let the government know you do not want to leave the EU, so they do not take further legal action.
